oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Kendalls Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with the Kendalls (performance group) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kendalls; Biff Collie Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Royce and Jeannie Kendall discuss how Royce's brother got the name Floyce -- (00:33) Royce reflects on his father's passing when Royce was young -- (01:29) Royce tells of how he would listen to the Grand Ole Opry and how his mother got him a guitar -- (02:28) Collie reflects on why Bill Anderson plays right-handed guitar -- (02:54) Royce reflects on working on a cotton farm -- (03:27) Royce and Collie discuss how Royce had to charge a battery to listen to the Grand Ole Opry -- (04:30) Royce and Jeannie reflect on how Royce and Floyce were uncommitted to music -- (05:37) Jeannie is revealed to be the only child of Royce; Jeannie grew up in St. Louis -- (07:05) Royce and Jeannie reflect on the first time they had sung together -- (08:30) Royce and Jeannie discuss the first couple tracks they had ever recorded -- (10:12) Collie has the Kendall's reflect the aspects of paying to record -- (12:01) Jeannie asserts the way they had recorded was the only way they could have -- (12:55) Leaving on a Jet Plane is discusses by the Kendalls, and Jeannie and Royce agree that it was a life-changing album -- (14:05) Jeannie and Royce tell about how they had given up their old lives to pursue their musical career -- (15:15) Collie and the Kendalls reflect on the relationship developed when working with one's child -- (17:13) Royce and Jeannie reflect on how Royce's wife had altered her life to allow the Kendalls to thrive -- (18:07) Collie has Royce discuss how he and his wife were originally beauticians together -- (19:01) Jeannie and Royce tell about how they started their careers in the studio -- (19:25) Jeannie and Royce reflect on an unidentified person -- (20:02) Royce says country music artists, including Eddie Arnold and George Jones, were his inspiration; Jeannie boasts about a larger diversity of musical appreciation -- (21:24) Royce and Jeannie reflect on how they developed their own personal style -- (22:32) Collie and the Kendalls reflect on similar sounding acts -- (23:39) Collie and the Kendalls address the Kendalls' relationship with Pete Drake -- (25:06) Royce reflects on getting a record deal from Bryant Fisher -- (25:40) Jeannie reveals the material the Kendalls had created prior to beginning to record and Royce and Jeannie reflect on their recording -- (28:29) The Kendalls discuss their experience on a tobacco farm -- (30:22) Collie asks about the Kendalls' status as tobacco farmers -- (30:33) Jeannie reveals they only grew one crop; Royce tells Collie about their move to Hendersonville -- (30:53) Collie and the Kendalls discuss the Kendalls' road performances -- (31:59) Collie has the Kendalls discuss how they constructed a band -- (33:06) Collie and Royce discuss Royce's time in barber school -- (33:39) The Kendalls address their equipment used during recording their first record -- (35:13) Jeannie and Royce reflect on Jeannie's love of Peter, Paul, and Mary; Royce and Jeannie reflect on John Denver being the host for the Grammy's -- (36:41) Collie presses Jeannie to talk about how she never dated before she got married -- (38:15) The Kendalls address what their future goals in entertainment are -- (38:53) Collie and the Kendalls discuss how Ralph Emery and Roy Acuff had been the biggest contributors to country music -- (40:14) The Kendalls express their thanks and Collie asks Jeannie about her future aspirations -- (40:47) Collie and Royce joke about Royce's future aspirations to become a fisherman -- (41:15) Jeannie reflects on her inability to plan for retirement -- (41:30) Jeannie tells about how she would stay at home for the foreseeable future and Royce tells his favorite vacation was Hawaii
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Kendalls (Musical group); Kendall, Jeannie; Collie, Biff;
